name: Taotie pendant
description:
Porcelain pendant with etched 'taotie' design in copper green

The Taotie is a mysterious Chinese motif often found on Shang and Zhou dynasty bronzes. Little is known about the meaning of these recurring designs, but it's believed that they had religious or ceremonial significance, possibly as a symbol of protection. One scholar wrote about the dual nature of the Taotie, as both fearful and mysterious to outsiders and beautiful and exalted to those tribes that used it. 

10 x 6 cm

Each Totem piece is a one-off from a ceramic artist studio in London, and comes in a Totem gift box with a card describing the piece 

Free delivery in the UK

name: Coral pendant
description:
Delicate porcelain coral pendant with etched surface on blue suede string

Known as the garden of the sea, coral has been used in decorative objects for thousands of years. It was believed to bring good fortune and offer protection from disease when worn as a necklace. Dreams about coral are believed to foretell recovery from a long illness. Ancients even believed that Mars was composed of red coral

Pendant approx 12cm long

Each Totem piece is a one-off from a ceramic artist studio in London, and comes in a Totem gift box with a card describing the piece

Free delivery in the UK
